The un sung hero of the building blocks of life DNA...... John Hammond

I am shouting at the wrong label "building block" being cytosine, guanine ect. These are nitrogen bases, the building block of DNA is called the Nucleotide which were discovered by P.A. Levene or Albrecht Kossel, internet is giving me mixed results. "He" also discovered the existence of the Nitrogen bases (cytosine, guanine, adenine and thymine). However, P.A Levene made the wrong conclusion of the tetranucleotides. The person to came up with the current theory used today regarding the nitrogen bases is said to be Erwin Chargaff. But even here I am finding many MANY names linked to the DNA molecule as so many scientists were working on the same thing, making wrong conclusions and disproved by others.

All research I found regarding Marie M. Daly does not mention her discovering the existence of the Nitrogen bases, she however made significant contributions in the fields of protein synthesis, histones, the uptake of creatine by muscle cell, and the relationship between hypertension and cholesterol.

Marie M. Daly still made massive contributions in the different fields and definitely a worthy mention. Whoever did your research regarding this amazing women, however, I feel is out of their depth because there is massive wrong facts based on the DNA molecule alone.
